TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ResourceFile extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A file to be downloaded to a compute node from Azure Blob Storage, such as task executables and task input data files.

MemberSignature.Value: public string AutoStorageContainerName { get; }
.property instance string AutoStorageContainerName
Public ReadOnly Property AutoStorageContainerName As String
member this.AutoStorageContainerName : string

Docs.summary: Gets the storage container name in the auto storage account.

MemberSignature.Value: public string BlobPrefix { get; }
.property instance string BlobPrefix
Public ReadOnly Property BlobPrefix As String
member this.BlobPrefix : string

Docs.summary: Gets the blob prefix to use when downloading blobs from an Azure Storage container. Only the blobs whose names begin with the specified prefix will be downloaded.
Docs.remarks: This property is valid only when or is used. This prefix can be a partial filename or a subdirectory. If a prefix is not specified, all the files in the container will be downloaded.

MemberSignature.Value: public string FileMode { get; }
.property instance string FileMode
Public ReadOnly Property FileMode As String
member this.FileMode : string

Docs.summary: Gets the file permission mode attribute in octal format.

remarks.para: This property is applicable only if the resource file is downloaded to a Linux node. This property will be ignored if it is specified for a which will be downloaded to a Windows node. If this property is not specified for a Linux node, then the default value is 0770.

MemberSignature.Value: public string FilePath { get; }
.property instance string FilePath
Public ReadOnly Property FilePath As String
member this.FilePath : string

Docs.summary: Gets the location on the compute node to which to download the file(s), relative to the task's working directory.
Docs.remarks: If the property is specified, this is required and describes the path which the file will be downloaded to, including the filename. Otherwise, if the or property is specified, this is optional and is the directory to download the files to. In the case where this is used as a directory, any directory structure already associated with the input data will be retained in full and appended to the specified directory. The specified relative path cannot break out of the task's working directory (for example by using '..').

MemberSignature.Value: public string HttpUrl { get; }
.property instance string HttpUrl
Public ReadOnly Property HttpUrl As String
member this.HttpUrl : string

Docs.summary: Gets the URL of the file to download.
Docs.remarks: If the URL is Azure Blob Storage, it must be readable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading the blob. There are two ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage: include a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the blob, or set the ACL for the blob or its container to allow public access.

MemberSignature.Value: public string StorageContainerUrl { get; }
.property instance string StorageContainerUrl
Public ReadOnly Property StorageContainerUrl As String
member this.StorageContainerUrl : string

Docs.summary: Gets the URL of the blob container within Azure Blob Storage.
Docs.remarks: This URL must be readable and listable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading blobs from the container. There are two ways to get such a URL for a container in Azure storage: include a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the container, or set the ACL for the container to allow public access.
